padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1075755" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Andy the Frenchy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165781.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Andy the Frenchy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1075755ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1075755" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781">Andy the Frenchy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-07-04">07/04/19 06:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh spicy/green citrus fragrance. A little thin for my tastes, but if you're looking for an old-school fragrance that is still wearable today, it's spot-on!<br />
<br />
Spring/Summer days, 30+</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1075755"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1075755#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1068499" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1068499" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ptilda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896037"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.896037.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ptilda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Beach-Walk-15261.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15261.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Beach Walk"title="Beach Walk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1068499ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1068499" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896037">ptilda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-09">06/09/19 06:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smelled like tart candy on first application drydown reveals a very lovely, fresh, herbal scent that borders on unisex and medicinal . . . Neither of which bother me. <br />
<br />
I'm testing from a stick applicator sample, so performance might be different if it was a different application method.<br />
<br />
Very nice, fresh scent, but I like my fresh scents to be a bit more complex OR have good performance OR be cheapies. Haha<br />
<br />
This one certainly makes me interested in testing even more from the house.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1068499"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1068499#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1060078" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1060078" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chrisk252"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="chrisk252" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cerruti/1881-Men-329.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.329.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1881 Men"title="1881 Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1060078ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1060078" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528">chrisk252</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-13">05/13/19 16:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh, ethereal, floral, slightly citrus opening. Pleasant slightly sweet, floral drydown. 9/10?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1060078"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1060078#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1047285" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1047285" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zesty_calco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005584"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1005584.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zesty_calco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geoffrey-Beene/Grey-Flannel-4608.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4608.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Grey Flannel"title="Grey Flannel"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1047285ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1047285" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005584">zesty_calco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-02">04/02/19 14:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lemon, pine and a little bit of peppery lavender in the background. At the opening I smell Lemonheads candy just like echo4kilo said. The pine comes out more in the drydown and the lemon goes powdery, dried lemon peel from grandma's potpourri bowl. Like other users I get furniture polish vibe from BB as well. There are some similarities to Dior's Eau Sauvage or maybe Alvarez Gomez's Agua de Colonia Concentrada but this smells older. Definitely smells like scent from 1902.<br />
<br />
Blenheim Bouquet is unisex leaning slightly masculine. Smells old timey and mature. Average to below average performance; lasts about four hours but whispers softly for longer. Works well in warmer weather and I don't think this could be offensive. Decent prices if you pick it up from an online discounter. The scent isn't very creative in today's market but imagining it nearly 120 years ago is pretty amazing. This is one of those scents everyone should smell to understand some of where perfumery has come from. Not bad but this is a pass for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1047285"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1047285#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1038016" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1038016" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1038016ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1038016" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-05">03/05/19 08:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've held off on reviewing until my bottle ran out, something that took more than two years. I've had mixed thoughts about Blenheim during that time. Sometimes I thought it awful bland, other days I adored it.<br />
<br />
Although I never outright hated it, for something to last two years is a lifetime on terms of my collection. I have been known to wear quite a bit! I burn through a bottle of Hammam Bouquet every two months. Despite writing a horrible review slamming it, my Savoy Steam did not last long and I'm on bottle two.<br />
<br />
I digress. After all this time, Blenheim is a joy. It's a simple beauty, it is fresh, airy and open. It doesn't ever cloy, it always uplifts. It does it in a very refined way. This smell isn't going to shock anyone but it does impress. It feels refined and well made.<br />
<br />
Where does it fit in the Penhaligons lot? Well for me it is mid pack, but I can see why it has been a bestseller for so long. I think Douro is a more interesting but less universal take. Zizonia is more classy. Lord George is more current and Castile does the citrus better. English Fern outdoes it in every way.<br />
<br />
It is better than almost all the portraits and a lot of the newer but not new stuff like Juniper, Endymion and Quercus. It is still a huge classic despite being over shadowed by some of its stablemates.<br />
<br />
It is piney and metallic without loosing its citrus freshness or mostly lavender hint of floral. Despite being originally made in 1902 this would be at home in most decades, especially the 90s. <br />
<br />
If you oversmell it and try to find deep depths from it you will be disappointed. This is one to just enjoy and let be not to overanalyse. <br />
<br />
Side products that I tired: The soap is lovely. The showergel classy if a little bland. The powder was disgusting despite the lovely packaging. The deodorant was excellent but is no longer made (as an aside any fan of Penhaligons now discontinued deodorants will find the Geo F Trumper ones a good replacement). <br />
<br />
I think this smell does encapsulate the grandest of English houses. I will probably get another bottle, it will probably take me years to use up as I won't want to wear it everyday or cover myself in it but that's OK, because when in the right mood this is unbeatable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1038016"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1038016#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1028677" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1028677" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glamsterdam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182416"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1182416.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glamsterdam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gritti/Antalya-16629.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16629.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Antalya"title="Antalya"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1028677ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1028677" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1182416">Glamsterdam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-02-06">02/06/19 17:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first time I tried this was when I bought a men's gift set (4x5ml scents) to re-familiarize myself with the Penhaligon's brand after 13 years.(2005-2018) I took my sample on holiday but I was traveling with my dad who, being used to cheap cologne, helped finish (waste) it in 2 or 3 days. I had to get more.<br />
<br />
So after my holiday I bought a new (10 scent)sample box at the same time that I bought Endymion.<br />
<br />
After using Blenheim again I put it on the list for my next shopping splash. This might not be for +20 or (wannabe) young +30 people but it is class and will definitely make a statement. <br />
<br />
And longevity? Breakfast to lunch. That's enough in my book.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1028677"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1028677#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1016866" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1016866" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aquatic Mountain Pikachu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009022"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1009022.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aquatic Mountain Pikachu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Acqua-di-Parma-Colonia-Assoluta-1682.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1682.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua di Parma Colonia Assoluta"title="Acqua di Parma Colonia Assoluta"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1016866ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1016866" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009022">Aquatic Mountain Pikachu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-04">01/04/19 17:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unfortunately its smell is too similar to a toilet freshener (I even used it for that purpose a couple of times.). I think it's because of that synthetic component which I can't name, but that dominates the base of it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1016866"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1016866#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent995538" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc995538" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="echo4kilo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153785.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="echo4kilo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Room-237-30364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Room 237"title="Room 237"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma995538ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd995538" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785">echo4kilo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-28">10/28/18 11:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I completely understand Blenheim Bouquet is from a different era. It is a very nice smelling fragrance with an initial strong lemon that turns to a pepper smell that is very nice too. The first thing I have to say is that it reminds me of Lemonhead candy. That strong taste of lemon when you bite through the candy shell is exactly what I am reminded up when I smell this. It smells good and if I lived in 1902 (30 years before indoor showering became common) I would spray this all over. Its is also interesting to smell the fragrances Penhaligons started with just for the history interest. I'm not sure I would ever be able to wear this outside of the sample I bought to test.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="995538"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=995538#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent992111" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc992111" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="giuseppe98gp83"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1114328"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1114328.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="giuseppe98gp83" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma992111ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd992111" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1114328">giuseppe98gp83</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-17">10/17/18 06:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In 1902 Penhaligon's produced Blenheim Bouquet. Several perfume masters tried to capture the smell of everything that exists among which the creators of this sublime colossus of the aforementioned Maison.This fragrance is a tribute of 1902 to the dukes of Marlborough and their Blenheim Palace, donated in 1704 by Queen Anne to John Churchill, first duke of Marlborough, as a reward for the homonymous victory against the French. It was one of the first citrus scents of history and still today is the best seller of the English house, also loved by many women. It reminds me so much the Dior Sauvage (2015). A nice treat!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="992111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=992111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent921840" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc921840" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="herecomesbob"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1105206"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1105206.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="herecomesbob" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Eau-d-Ombre-Leather-95389.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95389.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau d'Ombré Leather"title="Eau d'Ombré Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma921840ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd921840" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1105206">herecomesbob</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-14">03/14/18 07:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dried lemon peel, black pepper, pine - I don't really get the lavender.<br />
<br />
I can't decide whether this smells more like over-brewed chamomile lemon tisane or lemon Fisherman's Friend throat lozenges. I think the throat lozenges. Needless to say, neither of those are what I'd particularly care to smell like.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="921840"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=921840#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent885959" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc885959" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherry_Darling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1003821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherry_Darling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pascal-Morabito/Perle-Pour-Elle-47506.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47506.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Perle Pour Elle"title="Perle Pour Elle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma885959ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd885959" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc878052" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lishypants"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1077206"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1077206.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lishypants" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Bibliotheque-43324.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43324.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bibliothèque"title="Bibliothèque"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma878052ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd878052" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); ⛤</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="878052"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=878052#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent865763" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc865763" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karl pearson youtube"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1087777"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1087777.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karl pearson youtube" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Joop/Wow-Eau-de-Parfum-Intense-For-Men-57091.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57091.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wow! Eau de Parfum Intense For Men"title="Wow! Eau de Parfum Intense For Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma865763ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd865763" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1087777">karl pearson youtube</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-09-29">09/29/17 07:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>one of the best classic citrus scents around IMO, lasts all day (as does the citrus). A citrus and spice combo frag, the lime in this pops and is stunning, a true mans citrus scent that will never get dated</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="865763"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=865763#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent863405" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc863405" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mayor91"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086141"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mayor91" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floris/Special-127-5551.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5551.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Special 127"title="Special 127"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma863405ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd863405" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1086141">mayor91</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-09-21">09/21/17 21:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I must say that at first impression, this is probably not going to be your favorite. I heard someone say that it was an eau de fruit loop once, and I think that or lemon furniture polish pretty well sums up the INITIAL top note. Let it dry down just a little and you will find that it loses that chemical-like lemon feeling and really starts smelling like fresh lemon. <br />
<br />
However, this puppy shines when it hits those base notes. I like to think this is a "warm pine" which I think is rather unique. I am convinced that it is the dry down that as made this fragrance stand the test of time. I really, REALLY enjoy this fragrance. True to Penhaligon's form, it doesn't have outstanding sillage, but it's enough to occasionally get a whiff while you are sitting still. I'm certain that it isn't going to leave a trail a mile long, but really what you are paying for is class in a bottle with any of the Penhaligon's stuff. This is no different.<br />
<br />
Back to this "warm pine" note. I can't say that I've ever smelled this particular scent outside of a lumber mill. To be honest, that's really what it reminds me of. Have you ever smelled freshly sawn pine lumber? It has the smell of pine needles, but the saw has sort of burned it a little. This is the closest thing I can come up with to describe this smell. It's fresh, but it also feels a little burnt, or rather toasted. It's completely pleasant and will remind you of campfires without smelling like smoke. It's hard to describe, and perhaps that's what the black pepper adds to the show.<br />
<br />
 I definitely recommend this to anyone. Just wait 15 minutes or so before you walk outside with it, or you are going to have some stoners with the munchies following you  looking for fruit loops. <br />
<br />
8.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="863405"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=863405#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent836513" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc836513" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="theuntrainednose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/824145"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="theuntrainednose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hugo-Boss/Boss-The-Scent-Private-Accord-for-Her-50875.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50875.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boss The Scent Private Accord for Her "title="Boss The Scent Private Accord for Her "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma836513ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd836513" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/824145">theuntrainednose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-28">06/28/17 17:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Perfectly gender-neutral fresh citrus peel and plants.<br />
<br />
The opening is probably the juiciest, freshest. most natural citrus-lemony note I have smelled in fragrance.<br />
<br />
I would really like to own it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="836513"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=836513#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent833254" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc833254" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gtabasso"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.132621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gtabasso" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/True-Lust-Rayon-Violet-De-Ses-Yeux-29397.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29397.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="True Lust Rayon Violet De Ses Yeux"title="True Lust Rayon Violet De Ses Yeux"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma833254ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd833254" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132621">gtabasso</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-17">06/17/17 15:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a citrus aromatic, huge citrus, herbaceous, unisex</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="833254"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=833254#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent821129" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc821129" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fishwife"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1033613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1033613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fishwife" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Molton-Brown/Fiery-Pink-Pepper-Eau-de-Parfum-57718.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57718.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fiery Pink Pepper Eau de Parfum"title="Fiery Pink Pepper Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma821129ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd821129" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1033613">fishwife</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-09">05/09/17 09:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Blenheim Bouquet is a great mix of citrus (I get bergamot and lime) and light woody notes (very light lavender and a hint of pine)...an absolute classic that would smell great on anyone...I love these "historical" perfumes...they really are a time capsule to another time, another world...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="821129"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=821129#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent814527" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc814527" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="phenomenal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1008359"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1008359.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="phenomenal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-Cologne-51692.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51692.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus Cologne"title="Aventus Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma814527ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd814527" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1008359">phenomenal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-20">04/20/17 11:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sample of this from Penhaligon's storefront @ Stanford Shopping center in Northern California.<br />
<br />
The opening is a blast of lemon and lime peel. I like that it smells fresh but I cannot deny that it does remind me of the lemon scent you get from some common household cleaning products.<br />
<br />
It is enough to make this not work for me... you really do have to try everything on skin. I liked this fragrance on paper, but on my skin it is not working for me. I don't hate it but not something I will reach for again.<br />
<br />
Update: On the dry down the pepper, lavender and musk come through as the intensity of the citrus quickly dwindles away. The dry down is kinda nice for a barbershop fragrance but overall, this still is not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="814527"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=814527#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent806680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc806680" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vinyl_junky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vinyl_junky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geo-F-Trumper/GFT-5004.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5004.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="GFT"title="GFT"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma806680ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd806680" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736">vinyl_junky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-27">03/27/17 20:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love citrus aromatics, and I love Penhaligon's, but this just didn't work for me. The citrus-lavender-pine combination here just doesn't work. <br />
<br />
The opening is beautiful, with citrus and lavender notes, and you think "Ah, what a lovely eau de cologne!". That's when it starts to go downhill, and the pine kicks in. The pine stays throughout the drydown, and is positively noxious. The best way I can describe this is an eau de cologne trying to be a fougere, and failing miserably.<br />
<br />
I get weak longevity (2 hours, tops) with moderate sillage. If I bother wearing it at all, that is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="806680"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=806680#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent781527" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc781527" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wesleyhclark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410918"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.410918.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wesleyhclark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alfa-Romeo-Perfumes/Black-70093.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70093.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black"title="Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma781527ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd781527" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410918">wesleyhclark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-01-14">01/14/17 18:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh, this is VERY nice. It may be the best citrus scent I have ever smelled. Anyway, it's up well there. It starts as citrus and dries down to... green. Greenish. I want a bottle!<br />
<br />
My wife likes it, too.<br />
<br />
Update: I have a bottle. Longevity and projection sucks! I like it but I won't be replacing it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="781527"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=781527#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent775685" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc775685" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosesbecomeme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8568"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8568.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosesbecomeme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma775685ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd775685" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="775685"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=775685#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent773732" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc773732" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="davide2111"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/961038"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.961038.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="davide2111" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/James-Heeley/Oranges-and-Lemons-Say-The-Bells-of-St-Clements-12187.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12187.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oranges and Lemons Say The Bells of St. Clements"title="Oranges and Lemons Say The Bells of St. Clements"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma773732ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd773732" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/961038">davide2111</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-12-24">12/24/16 00:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Amo questo genere di fragranze ma questo Penhaligon's non è stato niente di eccezionale come mi sarei aspettato, sicuramente a mio parere l'errore è stato compiuto nella testa con il limone cui la contemporanea aggiunta di LIME in maniera copiosa ha reso "il volo del profumo" qualcosa di talmente pungente da far chiudere occhi e naso! Più prodotti di questo genero sento più cresce in me la convinzione che: i limoni, il lime, il bergamotto non devono essere mescolati in una fragranza i loro oli essenziali devono essere assoluti, portano con sè già un elevato potere acido da non avere bisogno di sovrapposizioni. Mentre arance, clementine, mandarini etc etc essendo più dolci possono essere messi contemporaneamente.  Comunque appena spruzzato è per almeno la prima ora è uguale a " Oranges and Lemons Say The Bells of St. Clements James Heeley ", altro prodotto che non mi aveva fatto impazzire. Purtroppo per me che sono amante del genere agrumato-citrico questo prodotto per quanto discreto non ha soddisfatto le mie aspettative peccato!<br />
Profumo 6,5/10<br />
Longevità 7,5/10 <br />
Sillage 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="773732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=773732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent767247" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc767247" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fuggerone"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/232253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.232253.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fuggerone" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma767247ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd767247" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/232253">fuggerone</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-12-04">12/04/16 10:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the main problem with this scent is duration and projection but if you go heavy with the sprayer you get a blast of lemon and musky woods, this scent was Winston  Churchill signature scent..originally made for the Duke Of Marlborough, back int the day this gem must have been a pure blast of classiness, with today restrictions it's a tamed beast.<br />
The architecture of the scent is very retro but it exudes classiness! I got some serious compliments from ladies!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="767247"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=767247#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent766890" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc766890" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spartan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59167"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.59167.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="spartan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Azzaro/Azzaro-pour-Homme-829.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.829.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Azzaro pour Homme"title="Azzaro pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma766890ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd766890" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59167">spartan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-12-03">12/03/16 09:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was surprised by this..Smells Exactly like Acqua di Selva...Exactly!! Also smells like Pino... Its good but for the $$ I will wear the Acqua di Selva.<br />
Hard to belive this came out over 100 years ago! Men were men.. No Fem scent here....</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="766890"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=766890#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent755176" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc755176" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kharnak Rex"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/550653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.550653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kharnak Rex" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Habit-Rouge-Eau-de-Parfum-25313.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25313.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Habit Rouge Eau de Parfum"title="Habit Rouge Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma755176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd755176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/550653">Kharnak Rex</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-24">10/24/16 20:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh bright lemon zest oil.   Sweet pine hidden in the back.   This isn't the candy like lemon from pine sol, it's a very rich oily kind of lemon.<br />
   there are many similar ones out there, like this body spray... it's meant to be worn with a leather jacket, to mix with your own scents.<br />
<br />
Rather simplistic, but well done, natural smelling.    Kinda reminds me of a much sweeter Lemony version of Pino Silvestre.<br />
<br />
Longevity:  kinda ok<br />
Sillage:  modest</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="755176"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=755176#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent753647" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc753647" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Angeldaisy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/903180"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.903180.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Angeldaisy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Acqua-Nobile-Iris-17487.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17487.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua Nobile Iris"title="Acqua Nobile Iris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma753647ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd753647" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/903180">Angeldaisy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-20">10/20/16 02:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i tested this cologne today and i got lots of lemons, a dash of lime. <br />
herbal lemons.<br />
herbal lemons with plasticine and paper.<br />
then finally, plasticine and ink. <br />
then the smell of a wooden kitchen chopping board that could do with a wash (it's been used to chop those lemons, but earlier in the day for other culinary choppings for that chicken marinade). <br />
lemons begin to smell like they have been cut and left out on said damp wooden chopping board after a party on a hot summers eve.<br />
when i was a silly teenager, i put lemon juice in my hair on holiday, having been told it would bleach it in the sun. it didn't. and after a day in the Greek sun, those lemons were far from zesty.<br />
why is it called bouquet? <br />
my nose can barely smell the lavender. and Penhaligon's are never usually shy on the lavender front, not with their perfumes i have with that note.<br />
i am seeking out the pepper listed and it does have an exceedingly feint white ground pepper in there, like the pepper pots on the tables at school dinners. ground a year previously and left out in the open for months (no kid uses pepper, other than for pranks).<br />
This is most definitely more man-some than lady-like.<br />
i like wearing citrus colognes, for their fresh transparency. this is not a smell i would enjoy wearing. the sprayer smells like divine spicy lemons, but the moment it hits warm skin, it sort of disintegrates.<br />
sillage is small, but longevity as skin scent was 6-8 hours.<br />
PS i love my Penhaligon's collection, so this was a complete surprise to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="753647"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=753647#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent738178" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc738178" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MDL77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013899"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MDL77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma738178ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd738178" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013899">MDL77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-09-01">09/01/16 10:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Here's the thing, I really, really wanted to like at least one thing from Penhaligon's, but I don't, my range goes to mildly disliking to finding some repulsive. I find Blenheim Bouquet loud and invasive. Like in most of their fragrances, there's at least always one ingredient I can never identify lingering making the scents loud and rather inexpensive smelling. I guess what I'm trying to say is that while they would smell wonderful, there's one or a few ingredients they use that makes them smell inexpensive and like there's a lingering hidden odor, if those ingredients that repeat themselves in almost all their fragrances weren't there, most would be great fragrances. In Bouquets case, I find it harsh, acidic and unbalanced, very intrusive and taking all the bad qualities of each scent and exalting them, instead of the good qualities of each ingredient, and this is one of the many that has that ingredient I can't pinpoint but I always detect and that I find disagreeable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="738178"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=738178#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent727466" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
