padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc723952" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Juniper1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1010427"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Juniper1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma723952ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd723952" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1010427">Juniper1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-07-16">07/16/16 05:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice, refreshing and classic. The magical interaction between pepper and citrus generates an amazing ginger-like scent, and ginger happens to be my favorite spice. I always picture an old-fashioned British gentleman when I smell it, but I know it actually suits a clean and tidy young man with casual clothing quite well because I've already got a lot of compliments from it:)<br />
<br />
Something disgustingly awesome that I found about Blenheim Bouquet is that when it's on a sweat-soaked T-shirt in a burning hot day, the mingled scent smells just SEXY AS HELL!!! Literally , I want to kiss myself.<br />
<br />
Longevity is so poor. Penhaligon's really should work harder on their longevity issue though I don't think they will.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="723952"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=723952#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent712960" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc705578" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lambda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981946"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.981946.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lambda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Jazz-Club-20541.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20541.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jazz Club"title="Jazz Club"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma705578ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd705578" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981946">Lambda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-14">05/14/16 13:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Two sprays on my arm, at sunset in spring: <br />
starts with a great combination of lime, lemon and lavender, then goes into a "pine mode". <br />
<br />
In my opinion, Blenheim Bouquet has one of the greatest, most beautiful and uplifting openings I've ever tried. Pine feels very realistic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="705578"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=705578#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent697813" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc697813" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="freewheelingvagabond"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/276879"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.276879.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="freewheelingvagabond" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Equipage-Geranium-32042.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32042.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Equipage Geranium"title="Equipage Geranium"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma697813ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd697813" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/276879">freewheelingvagabond</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-19">04/19/16 01:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's fascinating to think that Blenheim Bouquet first came out over a hundred years ago. <br />
<br />
I find it primarily to be a piney citrus fragrance. It is mildly spiced, and soft but resilient. The initial opening is lemony, and soon the pine comes through. Thereafter it stays the same on skin till fading away. It's not the invigorating citrus one seeks in summer; rather it's the quietly uplifting citrus that one sometimes longs for in the cold. <br />
<br />
I do not find it herbal, stark, bitter, sour or astringent - it is very well balanced. It's more dry, austere and reserved, and more refined than elegant. It's conservative - in a good way. It's gentlemanly, subtle and assured. And yes, it's very British in style. <br />
<br />
I imagine this is what the more gentlemanly characters in Hitchcock films would have smelled like, before Hitchcock went Hollywood. It has an undeniable old world charm, but is still relevant.  <br />
<br />
It's a skin scent, but it's meant to be. Low sillage and average longevity on skin. But it's satisfying. Use the EdT together with the entire range of grooming products. Strictly for gentlemen. <br />
<br />
My only little gripe is about the ingredients. If the quality were dialed up a notch or two, this would have been most excellent.<br />
<br />
3.5/5 (thumbs up)<br />
<br />
P.S. <br />
<br />
1. Anyone looking for something similar but with a little more flesh should look at Dior Granville. Another pointer that Blenheim Bouquet is not out of time or place.<br />
<br />
2. Do yourself a favour - kindly read the review of Blenheim Bouquet on Fragrantica by le mouchoir de monsieur. :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="697813"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=697813#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent695023" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc695023" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SauvageHound"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/250678"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.250678.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SauvageHound" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Venetian-Bergamot-31696.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31696.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Venetian Bergamot"title="Venetian Bergamot"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma695023ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd695023" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/250678">SauvageHound</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-09">04/09/16 17:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Classic, lovely, and refined, Blenheim Bouquet is citrus artfully wed to lavender, with depth added by pepper and beautiful pine.  It is simple, lasting, elegant, and uplifting.  This truly extraordinary fragrance is worth seeking out.  It is my signature scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="695023"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=695023#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent683128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc683128" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bigsly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/28013"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.28013.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bigsly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma683128ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd683128" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/28013">Bigsly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-03-02">03/02/16 15:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I obtained a sample as a newbie and it struck me as too harsh, in an industrial cleaning product kind of way.  Several years later I decided to try it again, and this time I was able to appreciate the drydown and complexity of this.  The lavender is of the dry/herbal variety, and doesn't seem to stand out, as if often the case with this note.  It's not obviously woody, as in a specific wood, but instead this is a great example of a very good composition.  There does seem to be something like a touch of tonka/benzoin/whatever softening this up every so slightly, though it's not listed.  It strikes me as a formal, warm weather scent, but I'd only suggest being concerned about this scent in a romantic or party social situation (though I think it would be fine for an office party at Christmas time).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="683128"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=683128#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent663621" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc663621" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Karma-Shave"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/844938"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.844938.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Karma-Shave" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floris/Patchouli-18666.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18666.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Patchouli"title="Patchouli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma663621ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd663621" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/844938">Karma-Shave</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-04">01/04/16 03:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first I didn't care too much for this scent, but because of the bottle design I kept reaching for it. I have since finished the bottle and am now contemplating on replacing it as this has very much grown on me. <br />
<br />
I would say that Blenheim Bouquet is not a young man scent but something for the more mature and distinguished gent, (40+). I have received good feedback from the ladies, again mostly from the 40+ age group. <br />
<br />
On first application the scent is bright with a lemon and lime citrus note which I find very invigorating, especially after a wet shave. Dry down approaches rather quickly, (30 minutes or so) leaving a rather uplifting and balanced combination of citrus infused with a peppery lavender.<br />
<br />
Both longevity and projection are above average with my skin chemistry, which is important. <br />
<br />
I would certainly encourage gents to try this, like me you maybe pleasantly won over!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="663621"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=663621#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent613015" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc613015" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma613015ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd613015" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-17">07/17/15 17:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It took me a long time to appreciate Blenheim Bouquet as a fragrance. The lemon and lime smell great. I guess the issue is that this has a slightly more formal smell to it. Its a very British scent. There are two very obvious stages. The first is the citrus and Lavendar. The second is the more fern like base. Perhaps the issue is with this fragrance is that it is slightly limited in who can wear it well. I have found young people do not appreciate the smell. Personally I have grown a liking to it and enjoy wearing it occasionaly. It's a fragrance that can be applied heavily or very lightly. It's a relatively subtle fragrance and in my opinion does not project greatly</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="613015"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=613015#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent604158" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc604158" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="racb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.927134.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="racb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Black-Orchid-Eau-de-Toilette-31969.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31969.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"title="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma604158ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd604158" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134">racb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-15">06/15/15 11:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can't pinpoint how I feel about this.<br />
<br />
Massive burst of lemons which then almost completely disappears, leaving something mossy, tangy and slightly antiseptic. I think it might be a grower though. I will keep trying and see if I can isolate this one.<br />
<br />
Complicated.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="604158"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=604158#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent594992" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc594992" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ddadam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/914514"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ddadam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma594992ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd594992" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/914514">ddadam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-15">05/15/15 10:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This turned out a total mess on the skin. From a distance the citrus is ok-ish, but upclose the pine-pepper stuff is indeed industrial type. I really cant imagine this being used on a daily base. I think this is better done in Creed Original Vetiver.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="594992"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=594992#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent592835" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc592835" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lucadantegabriel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/654831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.654831.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lucadantegabriel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bvlgari/Bvlgari-Man-In-Black-26358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bvlgari Man In Black"title="Bvlgari Man In Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma592835ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd592835" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/654831">lucadantegabriel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-08">05/08/15 08:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>agrumi, lavanda, pino... un classico esempio di come la semplicità possa portare ad un bouquet in modo altrettanto complesso rispetto alla profumeria moderna. E' un profumo di un altro secolo, che va contestualizzato. Il suo obbiettivo era forse più simile al sanificare, dare una nota di "pulito" al viso di un fumatore. Ed è questo che spicca, un senso di pulito.<br />
<br />
Un pulito non banale, un pulito molto complesso e articolato, diverso dai classici splash agrumati che nelle note di testa sembrano avere più somiglianza con un detersivo per piatti che con una istituzione profumiera.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="592835"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=592835#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent583332" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/204461">ThatMakesScents</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-11">08/11/14 15:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Is everybody copying Boucheron or what ? This smell keeps shows up in Xerjoff NIO. I found it in another citrus by Parfums De Nicolai and now I smell  this.<br />
<br />
 This is Boucheron Por Homme. They all are to some degree/variation.<br />
<br />
 You know what they say about copies. Better to get the real deal. :)<br />
<br />
 <br />
  If you like these types of citrus fragrances look for the Boucheron EDP.<br />
<br />
 This is an old word mossy lemon chypre.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="512646"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=512646#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent512462" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc512462" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma512462ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd512462" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-11">08/11/14 04:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Starts out as a decent lemony eau de cologne with some sharpness like Wellington. It becomes way too sour and then dry, with herbals that make me envision something used to season fish entrees (oregano?). I don't mind such herbalness per se, but the dry acridness of this mix could be confused with BO because nobody who encounters you will be expecting you to smell like Italian Seasonings. Other than that, I respect how they've accomplished this unique dried grass/herb/shrub smell. In the end, I like it more than I thought I would...probably the Penhaligon's that I'd most likely wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="512462"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=512462#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent505822" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Opening is a burst of sharp citruses, which consists of lemon and lime with a touch of musk. Perfect warm manly smell. Comforting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="474354"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=474354#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent465747" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc465747" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="400blows"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/215766"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.215766.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="400blows" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aftelier/Absinthe-19586.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.19586.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Absinthe"title="Absinthe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma465747ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd465747" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/215766">400blows</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-03-12">03/12/14 09:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First whiff before applying; smoke. Almost coal-tar. I'm reminded of the washing of hands with coal tar soap in luke-cool to cold water at sunrise in winter on a farm in the British Isles, and the city winter pall anywhere in the British Isles when I was there.<br />
Or the coppicing of the willows and the smouldering of the charcoal under the mounds.<br />
It is absolutely nostalgic. Rigour and austerity were once paradoxically comforting things. You knew the routine and stuck to it and as a reward you got beautiful memories of white frosts, misty sunrises, iced puddles, porridge with brown sugar and cream donated by the cow that morning, the institutional pot belly stove and gruff but kind leaders of the uniformed, scouting sort. A bit like Moonrise Kingdom with less eccentricity and more ordinary fun. No element of Catch 22 at all.  Serious, familiar goodness.<br />
<br />
Much later... There is something simple and sweet in the dry down. Coming to an ID, the imagination was whisked into a memory of cake baking.  I think it's the type of vanilla they call 'extract' where it's mixed with alcohol in the tiny bottles.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="465747"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=465747#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent451674" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc451674" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Layton S"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/739726"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.739726.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Layton S" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma451674ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd451674" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/739726">Layton S</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-30">01/30/14 03:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tied the perfume and the deoderant. I wasn't a big fan of the perfume, on me I got a huge blast of lemon in the begining which eventually almost completely faded to just a woody musky cedar like scent. I am however really enjoying the deoderant. The lemon is prevalant at first but it quickly balances out with the pine/pepper creating a very nice spicy fresh smell. As I'm not a big fan of the sporty fragrances this will probably be the only deoderant I buy from now on.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="451674"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=451674#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent435830" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc435830" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pinktojen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/711056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pinktojen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Vitriol-d-oeillet-12537.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12537.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vitriol d’œillet"title="Vitriol d’œillet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma435830ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd435830" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/711056">pinktojen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-14">12/14/13 12:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first smelled penhaligons in a hotel in NYC - a boutique hotel called The Carlton. Their house toiletry scent was Quercus. I could not get enough of it. When I looked up penhaligons and read all the descriptions and decide I must have the entire line. <br />
<br />
When I went on a business trip to Vegas where there was a Penhaligons boutique in one of the hotels. I remember trying on every single scent, being overwhelmed, and then deciding blindly that I was going to buy this one for my boy friend at the time (husband to be). <br />
<br />
I was terrified that it would smell horrible on him…but it didnt. I was quite struck when he first wore it. He has a warmer type of body scent which mixed with the smoky woods and citrus altogether smells like home to me.<br />
it smells like man and culture. Someone wearing this has a soul and you can have a conversation with him. He's going to write you a letter not just send texts. He will remember when you love a piece a of jewelry and it eventually shows up on your birthday. He will surprise you with a new bottle of serge lutens when you get back from a long business trip. <br />
<br />
The man wearing this is above money, insecurities and lust.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="435830"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=435830#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent431043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc431043" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Errol the Flynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Errol the Flynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atkinsons/The-British-Bouquet-18972.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18972.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The British Bouquet"title="The British Bouquet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma431043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd431043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054">Errol the Flynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-29">11/29/13 16:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is simply a classic Gentleman's aftershave. Imagine the typical London Gentlemen's club filled with upper class men smoking fine cigars whilst sat on old leather chairs and you have found Blenhiem Bouquet. The Fragrance starts off with a very citrus/lemon note and then as if by magic turns into a stunning incense smell not unlike the burning incense you find in a Church. In the background the citrus smell still sits there, but the dominance of the incense overrides the lemons etc and makes this scent just amazing. On a cold Winters day it just emanates class. It is no wonder the like of Winston Churchill and Prince William have used this fragrance. Penhaligon offer a true classic fit for a Prince and a Prime Minister.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="431043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=431043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent430291" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc430291" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma430291ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd430291" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-27">11/27/13 04:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm not surprised the notes in this rhyme... <br />
<br />
Lavender, Lemon and Lime,<br />
Pepper, Musk and Pine.<br />
<br />
It strikes a great balance similar to all the Penhaligon's I've sniffed out. Perfectly natural sharp citrus of Lemon and Lime(you can really smell both) with calming Lavender. The drydown yields a little pepper and gentle musk.<br />
My only criticism is that the combination of top notes give this a cleaning product type of vibe and I'm not one who usually says that about overly lemony or lavender fragrances because it's too easy to go there.<br />
At the end of the day I like and accurate citrus also love lavender and I like the subtle pinch of pepper, just works.<br />
This still has an elegance about it, Penhaligon's just pulls it off and Blenheim Bouquet has a clean feel but it's not the best offering from them although inoffensive and wearable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="430291"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=430291#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent402498" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc402498" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aussiecrew"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534128"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.534128.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aussiecrew" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5674.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Endymion"title="Endymion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma402498ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd402498" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534128">aussiecrew</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-03">09/03/13 06:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>'Penny Lane Penny Lane there is a barber showing photographs of every head he's had the pleasure to have known and all the people that come and go stop and say hello' by Paul McCartney captures the image of a London Barber and Blenheim Bouquet is the smell of a gentleman after he is well groomed and ready for action and adventure in the high seas. Fresh, invigorating, sparkly for the mature male with a sense of egotism for the finer things in life much like the Duke of Marlborough from Blenheim Castle whom it was made for. A right royal star I say o'chap!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="402498"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=402498#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent400609" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
