align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="400609"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=400609#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent377970" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc377970" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="surfergirlpuppy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/334436"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.334436.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="surfergirlpuppy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/First-776.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.776.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="First"title="First"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma377970ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd377970" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/334436">surfergirlpuppy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-17">06/17/13 19:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this and the shaving soap for the man in my life. It's simply amazing to walk in and smell this when he's shaving and spritzing. This is the most happy pleasant scent of peppery limes. I think I love it more than he does. I actually can't wash my hands in his bathroom without sneaking a sniff from the bottle. It smells super expensive and classy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="377970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=377970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent357717" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc357717" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Magie Noir"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/440811"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Magie Noir" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma357717ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd357717" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/440811">Magie Noir</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-04-18">04/18/13 16:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Excellent scent. You can feel the Victorian Era. There is this different type of magic when you wear it.<br />
<br />
It reminds me of my time spent on East London streets on a sunny December morning. As malcner said, it is great for cold weather too. For the classic gentleman that wears orange tie and and red socks with blue moccasins.<br />
<br />
Silage is bellow moderate, while longevity is 3.5hrs if you spray several times one after another.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="357717"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=357717#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent352718" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc352718" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="malcner"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/451142"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="malcner" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma352718ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd352718" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/451142">malcner</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-04-04">04/04/13 04:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I first smelled the bottle I thought; "hmm lemon sherbet...not for me". Then I got a sample and tried a bit on my wrist and thought; "actually, it might be good for summer, but I probably won't buy it". <br />
However, the other day I thought I'd try a different fragrance to work and I wore it out for the first time.....wow. I finally get it and love it!<br />
It's a particularly cold spring here in Scotland just now (about 3 degrees C on a good day!) and this fragrance goes perfectly with those cold, crisp and sunny mornings.<br />
I always thought of this as a summer fragrance, but it's the perfect scent for this time of year and the low temperature. <br />
I like to think that the obvious lemon note is like the sunshine, but the dry down brings a darker, spicier depth with strong incense throughout, making it very warm and comforting, especially during the cold mornings. Perfect. I work outdoors and smelling this all day lifts my spirits and puts me in a good mood. Like all the Penhaligon's, this just smells classy and well put together. It may not be particularly complex (although it is more complex than you first think, so give it a chance) but even the simple Penhaligon's just ooze elegance and class. There's not much more here than sherbet-y lemons, incense and a bit of musk and pine, but it's so nice! I'll be buying a full bottle next week!<br />
The only negative, as with a lot of Penhaligon's, is the longevity...not the best, about 3 to 4 hours on me. Projection is not too great either, but I think it suitable for this type of fragrance. You can smell it within a few feet which is fine, but the dry down is very close to the skin, so a spray top would be best in order to really get a good coverage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="352718"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=352718#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent308570" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc308570" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="williamvargas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/110306"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="williamvargas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Milano-Cento/Milano-Cento-For-Him-58220.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58220.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Milano Cento For Him"title="Milano Cento For Him"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma308570ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd308570" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/110306">williamvargas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-11-29">11/29/12 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>one amazing citrus scent, beautiful aroma, bottle worthy for me. such a fresh clean nice fragrance for a man to wear, got my sample today and it is just put a smile on my face,a signature worthy fragrance. a tad bit sour at first but calms down quickly...very nice citrus snap not a sweet scent to my nose but masculine.... two thumbs way way up...!!cannot stop sniffing this one..will be placing my order soon!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="308570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=308570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent249131" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc249131" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="le mouchoir de monsieur"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/191527"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.191527.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="le mouchoir de monsieur" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Habit-Rouge-Eau-de-Cologne-36508.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.36508.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Habit Rouge Eau de Cologne"title="Habit Rouge Eau de Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma249131ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd249131" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/191527">le mouchoir de monsieur</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-05-08">05/08/12 20:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No one had any idea the beautiful morning of September 11th, 2001 would turn to soot and misery before noon. I remember crossing 5th avenue at around 8:30am, and thinking that a more glorious morning could not be conceived: It was crisp, clear....the temperature was perfect. I wore a brown suit, a white shirt, and a solid red neck tie: I've never been one for novelties and prints. I could smell the lavender wafting up from my linen, as I sped up the lift to the 34th floor. By 9:30 all was mayhem. People were screaming. Then the second plane hit and the phones went dead. We were captive on East 49th street: Building security would not let us leave. Finally, by four in the afternoon, if we signed a waiver, we could go--and so I did. For three days Manhattan shut down, and most everyone stayed in their apartments. There was hardly any traffic on the streets, and very little noise. Many had unexpected guests who lived below Canal Street. Myself, I was alone, and sat in the quiet without television nor radio, internet access or phone service. It took me hours of concentrated effort to tape up the windows, as was suggested, along with air-ducts and door cracks. From that day on, all of New York City smelled like a backyard barbecue. "Ground Zero" smoked and gushed for months and months. A full year later it still smoked. Life just smelled of smoke, and loss: Every day for eight months I walked through funerals on Fifth Avenue: Huge ones--for all of the servicemen who lost their lives. They tend to put on quite a huge pageant in these instances. People didn't speak much at first. The clubs were full: Everyone kept drinking...but there just wasn't a great deal of talking. I, for the first time in my life, found that I couldn't wear perfume. Not only was I convinced my unwavering habit was unfit for such a gloomy time, nothing at all about it seemed alluring or necessary. Three weeks in to the New Era of Austerity and I gave in to a sudden urge to splash myself in signature brew, only to burst into tears as soon as I smelled it swirling around me. I would have to find a new one. In those days, there was a beautiful replica, all in wood paneling, of the Penhaligon's shop in London on the ground floor of Saks Fifth Avenue. I had fond memories of "English Fern," so I went there to ask which of their fragrances could be considered the driest, least frivolous, and, more importantly, which would accommodate this stench of smoke that would not go away. The host of the Penhaligon's boutique was an Englishman, as is fitting. I remember he looked me straight in the eye across his spectacles, and through them I could see his eyes becoming glassy. "This might do," he said. And with that remark I was handed a mouillete sprayed in Blenheim Bouquet. The numbness that lingered all over New York for months did not encourage any sort of enthusiasm, so I just gave it a brief whiff: It smelled of wood smoke, like everything else, with a bit of pine and lemon. "Perfect. The largest size you have please, in an eau de toilette." "We have a 500ml" -"That will be fine. I'm sure I'll enjoy it. Thank you." Though I can't say I did in fact enjoy it, I used the entire 500ml decanter to the last drop. Its severity and seriousness was very precisely suited to the broken spirits of all and sundry: Encouraging to those who "kept calm, and carried on." It took me a year to empty the bottle: When that year was past, New York still smelled like smoke, and so did everything and everyone, except none of us noticed it any longer: We'd all grown accustomed to it. Faced with an empty bottle of Blenheim Bouquet, I again tried my own signature scent, which had lain forgotten in drawers and cabinets, and still, it wasn't right: Too French. Too romantic. I can't smell like this, I thought, and that's when I knew: Sitting at my dressing table with an enormous empty bottle looking in the mirror I saw it in my eyes. Something was just over. One month later, I left. I left New York. I moved away. I still have the empty bottle of Blenheim Bouquet, and every year, on September 11th, I uncork it and give it a whiff. Every year, my thoughts vary...I remember odd things: How people who had lost love ones would burn candles in their windows...all of the "Missing" photocopy signs pasted all over every surface that nobody ever had the courage to remove, so they just disintegrated over time, while we walked by them, day in, day out, and watched. This year, I thought of how beautiful the morning was, and marveled at how that September would be the very last one like it: The beauty of innocence and the thrill and promise of early Fall in New York City, where everything was possible. None of that ever came back the way it was. But Blenheim Bouquet hasn't changed: A kind of therapy. Some days I would get out of bed only because I knew I would have my moment with it. I would look forward to rubbing it all over my chest, because when I did, invariably I would think that at least something was beautiful...and unchanged...and just that little bit of courage, a hint of hope that certain things endure, very often got me through the day. September 11th, 2011</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="249131"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=249131#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent229846" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc229846" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sbhammer73"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/159624"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.159624.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sbhammer73" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Douro-5672.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5672.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Douro"title="Douro"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma229846ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd229846" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/159624">sbhammer73</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-03-04">03/04/12 02:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I bought this, I thought I was buying a citrus fragrance and yes, the top notes are definitely heavily citrusy but the drydown was pepper'ish and the citrus disappeared, which was very disappointing, to me...and not a sharp pepper a la Poivre Samarcande by Hermes or Poivre 23 by Le Labo, but a very "gawky" pepper...Not buying a second bottle for sure! BTW, I love Penhaligon as a frag house and my favorites are Douro, Extract of Limes and Castile but Blenheim is nowhere close to being in this league of legends !!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="229846"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=229846#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent174329" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc174329" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jillzilla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17505"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17505.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jillzilla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Cinema-92.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cinéma"title="Cinéma"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma174329ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd174329" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17505">Jillzilla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-08-18">08/18/11 09:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is amazing!  On me, it opens with a very green citrus note...lemon and a little pine.  There are moments when I feel I can also smell thyme.  As it dries down, the lemon becomes less green and really takes center-stage.  I do not specifically pick up any of the lavender on my skin.  The base is just gorgeous to me, and a bit masculine with warm, musky woody notes.  <br />
<br />
I find this to be a slightly masculine unisex scent.  It's invigorating and uplifting in the beginning, and comforting and subtle in the end.<br />
<br />
Thumbs up Penhaligon!!  This should be marketed as unisex!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="174329"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=174329#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent164869" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc164869" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="adrienn99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27130"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27130.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="adrienn99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Al-Haramain-Perfumes/Belle-Rouge-63932.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63932.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Belle Rouge"title="Belle Rouge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma164869ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd164869" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27130">adrienn99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-07-14">07/14/11 11:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>at first i was quite scared by the blunt lemon opening... ugh and that herby upbeat...so i found it too crude and washed it off.<br />
<br />
now 30 minutes later i am sniffing for the source of a very pleasing aroma and it is my wrist with Blenheim bouquet.<br />
<br />
Very surprising - never been a fan neither to lemon nor lavander but this musky woody mix is very nice, gives a very clean classy feel. Although it is a little cold but very well done.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="164869"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=164869#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent157054" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc157054" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PiggyB"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/48905"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.48905.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PiggyB" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma157054ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd157054" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/48905">PiggyB</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-06-15">06/15/11 06:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I sniff this, unusual and complicated emotion comes up and runs through my body.<br />
I like lavender and citrus on the top.<br />
I feel I am soaked in cold deep sea water in the darkness.<br />
I was trying to swim and crawl, I reached the surface of the sea water finally by somehow, but the air I could breathe was filled by grey smoke regrettably.<br />
I appreciate this fragrance is listed as a gentlemannish item and still popular, although it is old fashioned.<br />
Someday I want to put some good memories to this fragrance, still soreness in it.<br />
<br />
But you’re all I need, my Dearest.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="157054"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=157054#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent111308" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc111308" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="olblueyez"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35193"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35193.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="olblueyez" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma111308ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd111308" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35193">olblueyez</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-11-17">11/17/10 16:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the best smelling stuff in the world for me. The soap is amazing and the cologne is my all time favorite.<br />
<br />
I wish more Women would wear this and others like it. I am so sick of flowery over ripe, sickening sweet, garbage they put out these days. For men and women alike. <br />
<br />
LADIES, please get some woody scents and bathe in them,,!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="111308"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=111308#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent108866" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc108866" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gypsy parfumista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16449.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gypsy parfumista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/House-of-Matriarch/Fitnessence-31063.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31063.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fitnessence"title="Fitnessence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma108866ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd108866" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449">gypsy parfumista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-11-02">11/02/10 13:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligons never disappoints. I expected (like sherapop) to find a manly floral scent; perhaps lavender, geranium and some violet with touches of chamomile and/or gentle sage... <br />
<br />
This is built around a lovely spicy lavender, but is much more a clean manly cologne than a floral one. The clear, crisp lemon note is very straight forward and blends with the lavender in a sheer and airy way. I, too, get a peppery scent that dominates the heart, at least at first. This gives way to an herbal note that reminds one of spring meadows and fresh growing mint. The drydown is woody, albeit a hint of sweet woods. The musk is sheer and very dry. All in all, this is (like many other Penhaligons) the epitome of sparse but luxurious British elegance.<br />
<br />
Sillage: fair to good<br />
Longevity: very good<br />
Overall: 4/5<br />
<br />
The scents from this House are subtle; there are dominant notes for sure, but they are so well blended with obviously natural components that some, used to more mainstream synthetic constructs, may call them "weak". They are not; as they have unbelievable longevity for such seemingly light scents. I touched a 3ml vial opening tight against my hand and inverted it to put an amount far less than one spray on the skin, and over an hour later it is plainly there and smells great, without putting my nose right over it. Penhaligons is well worth the medium-high prices they fetch...quality seldom, if ever, comes cheap.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="108866"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=108866#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent96599" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc96599" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="buckeye_pi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30793"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="buckeye_pi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma96599ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd96599" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30793">buckeye_pi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-08-22">08/22/10 14:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't ever remember being this disappointed in anything this highly rated. I got a sample at Saks in NYC and I literally gagged when I applied to my wrist. This was like spilling cheap pepper on my hand. I waited and waited but the dammed smell wouldn't go away (i guess at least it has good staying power.)<br />
I went to work hoping that nobody would mention it BUT if they did I was prepared to blame it on "the kid at Subway that spilled pepper all over me."<br />
Overpowering smell of pepper-what a disappointment!!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="96599"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=96599#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent89226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc89226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sherapop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sherapop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-L-Eau-38543.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38543.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"title="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma89226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd89226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027">sherapop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-07-10">07/10/10 11:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Whoops: I had thought that I was going to be reviewing a feminine floral perfume today, but Penhaligon BLENHEIM BOUQUET led me instead to another pleasant journey through fields of lavender!<br />
<br />
BLENHEIM BOUQUET is a high quality universal (unisex) fragrance with more lemon than lavender, and far more wood than either of those notes. The mystery "woody notes" smell to me like a cross between sawdust and vetiver. There is just a touch of darkness in the drydown, which has good longevity. The opening is not brashly aromatic, so this high-quality composition will work well year round.<br />
<br />
BLENHEIM BOUQUET reminds me of a couple of the Creed universal fragrances--the ones without the Creed water base. Good ingredients and measured application rather than mindboggling originality are the key to these pleasing creations, it seems to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="89226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=89226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent63955" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc63955" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="love_to_death_9"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/21065"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="love_to_death_9" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Paloma-Picasso/Paloma-Picasso-1009.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1009.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paloma Picasso"title="Paloma Picasso"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma63955ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd63955" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/21065">love_to_death_9</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-01-27">01/27/10 09:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>tooo much lemon,tooooo much!!!!<br />
Thedry down is woody and nice though.There is nothing sweet in it.It can be worn by women too.It reminds of Cabaret by Gres in the dry down...on my skin</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="63955"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=63955#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent50966" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc50966" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sky76sky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10157"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10157.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sky76sky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-IV-10756.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10756.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus IV"title="The Library Collection Opus IV"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma50966ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd50966" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10157">sky76sky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-10-26">10/26/09 13:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is hard to believe that this fragrance is over a hundred years old! A very simple yet intriguing fragrance.<br />
<br />
Like Jessmoberry, I find BB distinctly unisex, especially whilst in its opening stages. At first it smells fresh: a tiny touch of lavender with a quiet citrus crush, but it quickly develops into a warm, thick scent. <br />
<br />
Although jasmine &amp; saffron are not present in the mix there is the same thick sweetness with a faint metallic twang that is present in many jasmine/saffron scents I have sampled only here the sugar level is low, deep &amp; dry. How strange!<br />
<br />
The fragrance has no heart notes so when BB opens out into the base notes its masculine side develops - warm, dry &amp; woody. This creates an almost leathery stage where the musk, woods &amp; lemon combine. Within half an hour the woods are the dominant note - with a dusting of black pepper. <br />
<br />
To me it smells a little like old stationary sets locked away in a beeswax-polished writing desk. There is also the not-unpleasant cardboard smell Jessmoberry mentions &amp; I detect Basildon-Bond envelope gum &amp; quink ink.<br />
<br />
It is not a particularly lasting fragrance, nor does it leave a trail, but when mixed with Penhaligon's ultra-feminine, clear &amp; light Elisabethan Rose scent a truely unique masterpiece is created with plenty of depth &amp; dynamics.<br />
<br />
Penhaligon's scents really lend themselves to layering &amp; their high quality ingredients mean that there are very few that are sickly or likely to induce headaches. This is likely to be a very costly discovery!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="50966"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=50966#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent435830" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc435830" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pinktojen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/711056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pinktojen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Vitriol-d-oeillet-12537.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12537.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vitriol d’œillet"title="Vitriol d’œillet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma435830ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd435830" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/711056">pinktojen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-14">12/14/13 12:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first smelled penhaligons in a hotel in NYC - a boutique hotel called The Carlton. Their house toiletry scent was Quercus. I could not get enough of it. When I looked up penhaligons and read all the descriptions and decide I must have the entire line. <br />
<br />
When I went on a business trip to Vegas where there was a Penhaligons boutique in one of the hotels. I remember trying on every single scent, being overwhelmed, and then deciding blindly that I was going to buy this one for my boy friend at the time (husband to be). <br />
<br />
I was terrified that it would smell horrible on him…but it didnt. I was quite struck when he first wore it. He has a warmer type of body scent which mixed with the smoky woods and citrus altogether smells like home to me.<br />
it smells like man and culture. Someone wearing this has a soul and you can have a conversation with him. He's going to write you a letter not just send texts. He will remember when you love a piece a of jewelry and it eventually shows up on your birthday. He will surprise you with a new bottle of serge lutens when you get back from a long business trip. <br />
<br />
The man wearing this is above money, insecurities and lust.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="435830"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=435830#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1693351" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1693351" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="erika.isme.98"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404278"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1404278.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="erika.isme.98" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1693351ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1693351" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404278">erika.isme.98</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-21">11/21/22 16:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Things my partner compares this scent to despite me liking it:<br />
-Cleaner<br />
-Pencil eraser<br />
<br />
Too bad! It smells to me like home. <br />
<br />
 Nostalgic and gentle and comfortable. I grew up in North Carolina and the smells of lemon/lime remind me (only in the context of this fragrance) of my days drinking Sprite and eating homemade key lime pie. I would often overload my stepdad's coleslaw with black pepper. <br />
<br />
 I was often writing creative stories with old school pencils and being paid to clean my parents' once gigantic bathroom that had nice candles and a roomy bathtub I liked to spend time in. I would dance around and take my time cleaning thoroughly and enjoying the scent of their strongly scented lavender scented soap. Natural light and the shadow of pine trees filled our homes throughout my childhood. <br />
<br />
This must be why the notes in Blehmian Bouquet give me comfort. I will defend it with my full chest!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1693351"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1693351#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2015993" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2015993" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Owen Bawn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740382"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1740382.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Owen Bawn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Touch-for-Men-815.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.815.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Touch for Men"title="Touch for Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2015993ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2015993" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740382">Owen Bawn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-31">12/31/23 05:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you are a man who must project calm and quiet confidence without calling attention, Blenheim Bouquet remains the perfect choice. Physicians, psychiatrists and counselors, clergy, academics, and judges should consider this as an option for the workplace. While many are quick to point out that Blenheim was a favourite of Winston Churchill's, the fact that it was the daily fragrance of Pope John Paul II makes my point brilliantly. It's simple, unobtrusive, and calming. I love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="2015993"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=2015993#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent89226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc89226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sherapop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sherapop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-L-Eau-38543.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38543.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"title="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma89226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd89226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027">sherapop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-07-10">07/10/10 11:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Whoops: I had thought that I was going to be reviewing a feminine floral perfume today, but Penhaligon BLENHEIM BOUQUET led me instead to another pleasant journey through fields of lavender!<br />
<br />
BLENHEIM BOUQUET is a high quality universal (unisex) fragrance with more lemon than lavender, and far more wood than either of those notes. The mystery "woody notes" smell to me like a cross between sawdust and vetiver. There is just a touch of darkness in the drydown, which has good longevity. The opening is not brashly aromatic, so this high-quality composition will work well year round.<br />
<br />
BLENHEIM BOUQUET reminds me of a couple of the Creed universal fragrances--the ones without the Creed water base. Good ingredients and measured application rather than mindboggling originality are the key to these pleasing creations, it seems to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="89226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=89226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1038016" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1038016" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1038016ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1038016" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-05">03/05/19 08:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've held off on reviewing until my bottle ran out, something that took more than two years. I've had mixed thoughts about Blenheim during that time. Sometimes I thought it awful bland, other days I adored it.<br />
<br />
Although I never outright hated it, for something to last two years is a lifetime on terms of my collection. I have been known to wear quite a bit! I burn through a bottle of Hammam Bouquet every two months. Despite writing a horrible review slamming it, my Savoy Steam did not last long and I'm on bottle two.<br />
<br />
I digress. After all this time, Blenheim is a joy. It's a simple beauty, it is fresh, airy and open. It doesn't ever cloy, it always uplifts. It does it in a very refined way. This smell isn't going to shock anyone but it does impress. It feels refined and well made.<br />
<br />
Where does it fit in the Penhaligons lot? Well for me it is mid pack, but I can see why it has been a bestseller for so long. I think Douro is a more interesting but less universal take. Zizonia is more classy. Lord George is more current and Castile does the citrus better. English Fern outdoes it in every way.<br />
<br />
It is better than almost all the portraits and a lot of the newer but not new stuff like Juniper, Endymion and Quercus. It is still a huge classic despite being over shadowed by some of its stablemates.<br />
<br />
It is piney and metallic without loosing its citrus freshness or mostly lavender hint of floral. Despite being originally made in 1902 this would be at home in most decades, especially the 90s. <br />
<br />
If you oversmell it and try to find deep depths from it you will be disappointed. This is one to just enjoy and let be not to overanalyse. <br />
<br />
Side products that I tired: The soap is lovely. The showergel classy if a little bland. The powder was disgusting despite the lovely packaging. The deodorant was excellent but is no longer made (as an aside any fan of Penhaligons now discontinued deodorants will find the Geo F Trumper ones a good replacement). <br />
<br />
I think this smell does encapsulate the grandest of English houses. I will probably get another bottle, it will probably take me years to use up as I won't want to wear it everyday or cover myself in it but that's OK, because when in the right mood this is unbeatable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3940"comment_id="1038016"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Blenheim-Bouquet-3940.html?ccid=1038016#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3940" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
